snippet: President Mohamed Morsi’s decree to investigate the killing of protesters before and during the uprising appeared to be a challenge to the authority of Egypt’s security services.
abstract: Pres Mohamed Morsi of Egypt appoints a 16-member committee to investigate the killings of protesters in early 2011 and after the uprising, and orders state institutions to cooperate with the committee's work.
lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi’s decree to investigate the killing of protesters before and during the uprising appeared to be a challenge to the authority of Egypt’s security services.

headline.seo: Egypt’s Leader, Morsi, Orders Inquiry on Killings
headline.main: Egypt’s New Leader Orders Inquiry on Killings of Protesters
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s New Leader Orders Inquiry on Killings of Protesters
